channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Watch NPR's live special coverage of the RNC tonight
item.description: Republicans holds President Donald Trump’s nominating convention this week in Milwaukee. Watch NPR's live in-studio special coverage tonight starting at 9 p.m. ET
item.content:encoded: Republicans holds President Donald Trump’s nominating convention this week in Milwaukee. Watch NPR's live in-studio special coverage tonight starting at 9 p.m. ET
item.dc:creator: Heidi Glenn

item.title: What will Trump tell the RNC after an attempt on his life?
item.description:
Donald Trump's message for America has long been one of grievance and retribution.

What will he say at the Republican National Convention this week, after an attempt on his life?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Donald Trump's message for America has long been one of grievance and retribution.

What will he say at the Republican National Convention this week, after an attempt on his life?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)

item.title: Five things to know about J.D. Vance’s ties to tech billionaires
item.description: Vance, who has become a darling to the Silicon Valley elite, made inroads in tech and venture capital circles during a stint in San Francisco. Now, Vance is tapping that network to supercharge the Trump re-election bid.
item.content:encoded:
Vance, who has become a darling to the Silicon Valley elite, made inroads in tech and venture capital circles during a stint in San Francisco. Now, Vance is tapping that network to supercharge the Trump re-election bid.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Bernice Johnson Reagon, a founder of The Freedom Singers and Sweet Honey in the Rock, has died
item.description: The songleader, civil rights activist and scholar died at the age of 81.
item.content:encoded:
The songleader, civil rights activist and scholar died at the age of 81.

(Image credit: Astrid Stawiarz)
item.dc:creator: Adwoa Gyimah-Brempong

item.title: Kai Trump, the former president's 17-year-old granddaughter, will speak at the RNC tonight
item.description: Kai is expected to take the RNC stage tonight along with her father Donald Trump Jr. and Kimberly Guilfoyle.
item.content:encoded:
Kai is expected to take the RNC stage tonight along with her father Donald Trump Jr. and Kimberly Guilfoyle.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Biden tests positive for COVID. It comes at an awkward time in his campaign
item.description: This is the president's second bout with the virus. He was campaigning in Las Vegas when he found out his cold symptoms were COVID.
item.content:encoded:
This is the president's second bout with the virus. He was campaigning in Las Vegas when he found out his cold symptoms were COVID.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: U.S. Fish and Wildlife invokes federal water rights to protect huge swamp in Georgia
item.description: Parts of the massive Okefenokee Swamp are a wildlife refuge. Georgia is on the cusp of permitting a titanium dioxide mine next to it, prompting the federal government to invoke federal water rights.
item.content:encoded: Parts of the massive Okefenokee Swamp are a wildlife refuge. Georgia is on the cusp of permitting a titanium dioxide mine next to it, prompting the federal government to invoke federal water rights.
item.dc:creator: Marisa Mecke

item.title: Black men exonerated after mutiny charges during WWII
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with producer Dan Collison about his documentary on the Port Chicago 50, a group of Black sailors who were charged with mutiny for refusing to work under unsafe conditions.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with producer Dan Collison about his documentary on the Port Chicago 50, a group of Black sailors who were charged with mutiny for refusing to work under unsafe conditions.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: Law enforcement that helped with Trump rally security is under international scrutiny
item.description: Four days after the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump, investigators are still trying to uncover details about security lapses and the shooter's motive.
item.content:encoded: Four days after the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump, investigators are still trying to uncover details about security lapses and the shooter's motive.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: A preview of Trump's message for tomorrow's big speech
item.description: On Thursday night, former President Donald Trump will formally accept the republican nomination for President. What will his message be? Has that message evolved since the assassination attempt?
item.content:encoded: On Thursday night, former President Donald Trump will formally accept the republican nomination for President. What will his message be? Has that message evolved since the assassination attempt?
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez
